video.title: How to Make a Landing Page using HTML, SCSS, and JavaScript - Full Course
video.description:
Learn how to build a responsive website from scratch with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

✏️ This course was created by Jessica Chan.
🔗 Jessica's YouTube Channel: https://www.youtube.com/thecodercoder
🔗 Jessica's Twitter: https://twitter.com/thecodercoder

💻 Starter files from Fontend Mentor: https://www.frontendmentor.io/challenges/easybank-landing-page-WaUhkoDN
💻 Source code on GitHub: https://github.com/thecodercoder/fem-easybank
🔗 Responsive Design for Beginners course: https://coder-coder.com/responsive/

⭐️ Course Contents ⭐️
⌨️ (0:00) Introduction
⌨️ (0:30) Part 1: Setup and Navigation Bar
⌨️ (49:52) Part 2: Animated Hamburger Menu
⌨️ (1:21:28) Part 3: Animated Mobile Menu
⌨️ (1:43:56) Part 4: Responsive Hero
⌨️ (2:39:24) Part 5: 4-Column Features (flexbox)
⌨️ (3:16:58) Part 6: 4-Column Articles (CSS grid)
⌨️ (4:04:56) Part 7: Footer

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://freecodecamp.org/news

topLevelComment.author: Pengguna YouTube
topLevelComment.text:
Guys, in the navbar section, after I make breakpoints mixin and imported it to style.scss, it said that breakpoint-up and down mixin can't be found, but when I put the @import "mixins" in top of global.scss it's working

Do anyone know why is that?

replies.author: Pengguna YouTube
replies.text:
Ah never mind guys, I found the problem already, 

In style.scss, I put @import mixin after @import global which make the mixin doesn't recognized in globals

And after I put it before @import global it's working just fine

*I'll leave the comment for anyone who found the same problem with me

replies.author: FaireVex
replies.text:
in order to set up a custom folder for your css to go to for example she named her "dist".
you will need to go to : 
settings-->Extensions-->Live Sass Compile config-->Live Sass Compile>Settings: Exclude List 

after you click in Edit in settings.jsong 
you have to look for "savePath": "/in here put the name of the folder you want your css to go to for example "dist""
"savePath": "/dist"

replies.author: Samuel Chukwuzube
replies.text: Hello. You need to unlink the scss file cus the browser only understands .html, .css and .js files. The sass file needs to be compiled into css to work in the browser. You can create a style.css file and use this on the command line if sass is installed. sass --watch style.scss style.css or check sass-lang.com for other options. if you dont have sass installed, u can run this command: npm install -g sass or use the glen marks live sass extension for vscode. I would advice u stick with css until u gain a stable understanding of css before using sass.

Will the Messiah really eliminate all evil?

′′ You loved justice and you hate wickedness. Therefore God, your God, has anointed you with oil of celebration more than your companions ′′ (Psalm 45:7 [45:8, BE])

Those who rule have the responsibility to uphold the law. But the tame selves will possess the earth, and in reality they will try exquisite delight in the abundance of peace ′′ (Psalm 37:10, 11).

What kind of change can we expect?

God will fully fulfill his promise to create ′′ new heavens ", a just government that will administer a ′′ new land ′′ (Isaiah 65:17). The Kingdom of God governed by the Messiah will provide a definitive and universal answer to the challenge thrown to the name and in God's purpose.

The prophecy continues: ′′ They will not damage nor cause ruin throughout my holy mountain; for the earth will certainly be filled with Jehovah's knowledge as the waters cover the same sea ′′ (Isaiah 2:4; 11:9).

I'm having so much fun watching you! And it helps a lot at how to manage a project when doing html and css.
Wanted to say that for the Fade in/out animation for the overlay you used "visibility: hidden" property instead of "display: none". Using visibility is not that good for SEO since Google tends to penalize webs that hide content in this way.
"visibility: hidden" does hide the content but it is still there in the HTML, you're still rendering the overlay div but just hiding it from the eyes. "display: none" on the other side removes the element completely from the html.

Anyway I'll keep watching this video tomorrow, you're great :D

topLevelComment.author: David Ho
topLevelComment.text:
another great video from Coder Coder senpai!
I want to point out that @import have been deprecated. 
In style.scss, you can use @forward "file name". 
In the file where you are using it, use @use "file path" as * instead.
Kevin Powell did a great video on this called "Stop using @import with Sass | @use and @forward explained"
Also, you can name the file "index.scss" that way the path will become "../scss" instead of "../scss/style"
Wish you all the luck fellow coders. :)

replies.author: Dragos Jianu
replies.text:
Hi guys. This might have to do with the Prettier Extension. And the setting you want to change is the Prettier: Print Width. My setting is 80. That means the length of the line (in characters). If your line is longer than 80 characters, prettier will automatically breaks the code to new lines like this: each tag in a separate line, if the tag has multiple attributes, each attribute to separate line.
This applies not only HTML, but with JS and CSS, (of course in CSS there are few cases when the line is bigger than 80 chars. 
Hope this was helpful

topLevelComment.author: arunashaf mollick
topLevelComment.text:
As a suggestion: You can set the root font-size to 62.5% in the html selector which equals to 10px and use it so that you don't have to calculate all the time to convert to rem.
html{
font-size: 62.5%
}
 Suppose   you want font-size 18px; you set font-size=1.8rem, 1.8*10px=18px or you want font-size 14px, set font-size=1.4rem or for any value let's say 20px, 30px, 40px, 45px or even 23.4px
20px = 20/10px = 2rem, 
30px = 30/10 = 3rem,
40px = 40/10 = 4rem,
45px = 45/10 = 4.5rem,
23.4px = 23.4/10 = 2.34rem,
14px = 14/10 = 1.4rem,
18px = 18/10 = 1.8rem,
12px = .........=.......rem, 
left as a challenge.

Setting the root font-size to 62.5% makes it easier. Correct me, if I'm wrong.

topLevelComment.author: Julio Codes
topLevelComment.text: A simple solution to the fade-in/fade-out animation w/o using JS would have been to keep only the opacity to hide the visibility while still keeping the animation when toggling the classes. At the same time, since the overlay is always on top of the content (since opacity only hides it and does not remove it from the DOM) one could use a negative z-index which is then set to initial when the nav is toggled. Example: .element{ opacity: 0; z-index: -1; transition: opacity .5s;}  then .open  .element{ opacity: 1; z-index: initial;}
